text.p: These are the leading stories in Zambia's press on Thursday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The ruling party has accused some civic groups of involvement in a disinformation campaign aimed at disrupting presidential and parliamentary elections to be held this year.
- The government is to increase the length of time suspects can be held before appearing in court from 24 to 77 hours, home affairs minister, Chitalu Sampa, said on Wednesday.
